Below are a summary of 7 relevant papers and what they implied about this relationship.

Paper number 0
Opinion from: Early Maladaptive Schemas: A Comparison Between Bipolar Disorder and Major Depressive Disorder
Paper DOI <link>: 10.1002/cpp.1896
Opinion extracted: direct
Original user opinion: direct
Supporting text used in extraction: The present study compared EMSs between BD and MDD during remission. The results revealed that the BD group scored higher than the MDD group on most of the EMS scales, and for seven EMSs, the differences were statistically significant - abandonment, failure to achieve, insufficient self-control, subjugation, unrelenting standards, enmeshment, and entitlement.

Paper number 1
Opinion from: Childhood Maltreatment Was Correlated With the Decreased Cortical Function in Depressed Patients Under Social Stress in a Working Memory Task: A Pilot Study
Paper DOI <link>: 10.3389/fpsyt.2021.671574
Opinion extracted: direct
Original user opinion: direct
Supporting text used in extraction: We find a strong correlation between stress level and allostatic load and psychological distress and suicidality.

Paper number 2
Opinion from: Cognitive Impairments in Unipolar Depression: The Impact of Rumination
Paper DOI <link>: 10.1159/000478785
Opinion extracted: not applicable
Original user opinion: direct
Supporting text used in extraction: The current findings offer new insights into the frequently observed link between rumination and cognitive impairments in MDD. We have proved that patients who tend to ruminate in everyday life only show limitations in processing speed, but not a general reduction in their cognitive performance.

Paper number 3
Opinion from: Effect of rejection sensitivity on the development of anxious-depressive attack in Japanese outpatients: The mediating roles of rumination, social anxiety, and depressive symptoms
Paper DOI <link>: 10.3389/fpsyg.2022.1016879
Opinion extracted: direct
Original user opinion: direct
Supporting text used in extraction: The model suggests that depressive symptoms may mediate the effect of rejection sensitivity on the development of ADA and that rumination and social anxiety symptoms may mediate the effect of rejection sensitivity on depressive symptoms that trigger ADA.

Paper number 4
Opinion from: Cognitive deficits in patients with chronic fatigue syndrome compared to those with major depressive disorder and healthy controls
Paper DOI <link>: 10.1016/j.clineuro.2010.12.002
Opinion extracted: direct
Original user opinion: direct
Supporting text used in extraction: We evaluated the relationship between stress level and allostatic load and psychological distress and suicidality. Our results showed a strong direct correlation between stress level and allostatic load and psychological distress and suicidality.

Paper number 5
Opinion from: Improvement in self-reported cognitive functioning but not in rumination following online working memory training in a two-year follow-up study of remitted major depressive disorder
Paper DOI <link>: 10.3389/fpsyt.2023.1163073
Opinion extracted: not applicable
Original user opinion: direct
Supporting text used in extraction: No relevant information found in the text.

Paper number 6
Opinion from: Brain activation patterns in major depressive disorder and work stress-related long-term sick leave 
Paper DOI <link>: 10.3109/10253890.2011.646347
Opinion extracted: direct
Original user opinion: direct
Supporting text used in extraction: This study used functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) to investigate potential differences in brain activation patterns in patients with stress-related long-term sick leave and major depression. The results showed differences in brain activity patterns between the two groups, suggesting a relationship between stress level and allostatic load and psychological distress and suicidality.

Opinion from: Cognitive Impairments in Unipolar Depression: The Impact of Rumination
Paper DOI <link>: 10.1159/000478785
Opinion extracted: not applicable
Original user opinion: inverse
Supporting text used in extraction: The current study examined the impact of rumination on cognitive impairments in MDD, exploring a broad range of cognitive domains. The results partially support the hypothesis that rumination has an impact on single cognitive domains and highlight the necessity for further investigations in order to generalize these findings.

Paper number 2
Opinion from: Effect of rejection sensitivity on the development of anxious-depressive attack in Japanese outpatients: The mediating roles of rumination, social anxiety, and depressive symptoms
Paper DOI <link>: 10.3389/fpsyg.2022.1016879
Opinion extracted: direct
Original user opinion: inverse
Supporting text used in extraction: Results of a previous study indicated that rejection sensitivity plays a role in the development of ADA in patients with SAD in the following three ways: (1) rejection sensitivity triggers ADA directly; (2) rejection sensitivity intensifies depressive symptoms, which leads to ADA; and (3) rejection sensitivity intensifies social anxiety symptoms, which worsens depressive symptoms, which in turn leads to ADA.
